_header: When Phoebus dwelled here in this earth adown
_description: Geoffrey Chaucer, the Manciple’s Tale of the Canterbury Tales — 258 lines in rhyming couplets.

BodArcSelB14.First Lines:
Whan Phebus duelt here in this erthe adounas olde bookes maken
                    mencioun…
BodArcSelB14.Last Lines:
…whereso euere thow come amonges highe or lowekepe wel thi
                    tonge & thenke vppon the crowe
BodArcSelB14.Attributed Title:
…And / next folowyng bigynneth his tale (f. 263v); the
                    Maunciple (RT); Here endith the Maunciple his prolog… (sic; f.
                        263v)

BodBar20.First Lines:
Whan Phebus dwellid in þis erth adounAs old bokes maken
                    mencion…
BodBar20.Last Lines:
…W[her?]so þou come among high or loweKe[pe?] wel þy
                    tong and þenke vpon þe crowe
BodBar20.Note:
IX.297-304 omitted. A ten-line blank space follows, with the verso also
                    blank.
BodBar20.Attributed Title:
…& here begynnyth þe tale (f. 256v); here endith
                    þe Manciples tale (f. 260)

Bod414.First Lines:
[W]hen Phebus duelt here in þe erþe adounAs olde Bokis
                    maken mencioun…
Bod414.Last Lines:
…Wherso thou come among high or loweKepe wele thy tung and
                    think on the Crowe
Bod414.Attributed Title: The Maunciples tale of the Crow (f. 181)

Bod686.First Lines:
When phebus dwelt in þis worlde a dounAs olde bokes maken
                    mencioun…
Bod686.Last Lines:
…Where so euer þou come among high or loweKepe wel
                    þi tonge and þinke wel on þe crowe
Bod686.Attributed Title:
…And begynneþ / A lytel Tretis of þe Crowe (f.
                        173v); Lydgate (RT); Here endeth the tale of þe Crowe…
                    (f. 176v)

BodHatDon1.First Lines:
Whan Phebus dwelt in þis erth here adowneAs olde bokis maketh
                    mencioun…
BodHatDon1.Last Lines:
…Where so thou come amonges hie or loweKepe wele thi tonge and
                    thenk vpon the crowe

BodLauMis600.First Lines:
WHen Phebus duelt hire in þis erþe adounAs olde bokes
                    make mencioun…
BodLauMis600.Last Lines:
…Wher so þou comest amonges hie or loweKepe wel þi
                    tonge and þenke vpon þe crowe
BodLauMis600.Attributed Title:
…HEre begynneþ þe tale (f. 264v); þe
                    maunciple (RT); Here endeþ þe manciples tale of þe crowe…
                    (f. 268v)

BodRawPoe141.First Lines:
When that Phebus dwelled in this world adounAs olde bokes maken
                    mensyoun…
BodRawPoe141.Last Lines:
…Now had this Phebus in his hous a wyfWheche that he loued
                    more than his lyf…
BodRawPoe141.Note:
Everything after IX.140 lost. Catchphrase on f. 157v:
                    ‘And night & day’.
BodRawPoe141.Attributed Title:
Here bigynneth the Maunciples tale of a crow (f. 157); The Maunciple
                    (RT)

BodRawPoe149.First Lines:
When phebus here dwelled in the worlde adounAs olde bokes make
                    mencion…
BodRawPoe149.Last Lines:
…Wherso thou comeste amonge hihe or loweKepe wel thi tunge and
                    thynke on the crowe
BodRawPoe149.Attributed Title:
here begynneth the maunciples tale (f. 119v); fab mansiple (f.
                        119v, margin); maunsiple (RT); here endith the maunciples
                    tale… (f. 121)

                    mencioun…
OxfChrCh152.Last Lines:

                    tunge and thynke vpon the crowe

OxfCCC198.First Lines:

                    maken mencioun…

                    tunge and þenk vpon þe crowe

OxfTri49.First Lines:
Whenne Phebus dwellid here in this erth adowneas olde bokis maken
                    mencion…
OxfTri49.Last Lines:

CULGg427.First Lines:
WHan phebus dwellede heere in this erthe adounAs olde bokys makyn
                    mencioun…
CULGg427.Last Lines:
…Wheere so thow come a mongis highe or loweKeek [sic] weel
                    thyn tunge & think vp on the Crowe
CULGg427.Attributed Title:
Here begynneth the Manci ple hys tale (f. 395); Here is endit the
                    Mauncipell tale (f. 398v)

                    maken mencion…
Bodmer48.Last Lines:
…& wher so þou come among high or lowkepe wel thi
                    tong & think on the crowe
Bodmer48.Attributed Title: The manciples tale of the Crow (f. 212, rubric)
Bodmer48.Facsimiles:
“Digital
                    Facsimile of Cologny, Fondation Martin Bodmer, Cod. Bodmer 48”
